confirmation.change_admin_role: This will have serious impacts on this user's permissions. Are you sure?
confirmation.delete_user: Are you sure you want to delete this user? There is no going back.
confirmation.demote_own_account: You will no longer be an administrator. Really sure?
confirmation.edit_own_account: This is your own account. Are you sure?
confirmation.purge_password_reset_reques: Are you sure you want to revoke the previous request?
confirmation.request_password_reset: Are you sure you want to reset this user's password?
error.2fauth_has_not_a_valid_domain: 2FAuth's domain is not a valid domain
error.account_managed_by_external_provid: Account managed by an external provider
error.cannot_decode_detected_qrcode: Cannot decode detected QR code, try to crop or sharpen the image
error.cannot_demote_the_only_admin: Cannot demote the only admin account
error.cannot_detect_qrcode_in_image: Cannot detect a QR code in the image, try to crop the image
error.data_cannot_be_refreshed_from_serv: Data cannot be refreshed from server
error.error_during_data_fetching: üíÄ Something went wrong during data fetching
error.failed_icon_store_database_togglin: Migration of icons failed. The setting has been restored to its previous value.
error.failed_to_load_settings: Failed to load settings from the store
error.failed_to_retrieve_encryption_stor: Failed to retrieve encryption store data
error.failed_to_set_autolock_delay: Failed to set the auto-lock delay
error.field_is_required_and_valid_url: The field is required and must be a valid URL
error.invalid_or_unknown_token: Invalid or unknown personal access token
error.no_icon_for_this_variant: No icon available in this variant
error.no_pwd_reset_for_this_user_type: Password reset unavailable for this user
error.reserved_name_please_choose_someth: Reserved name, please choose something else
error.security_error_check_rpid: Security error: Check your WEBAUTHN_ID env var
error.spaces_are_ignored: Unwanted spaces will be automatically removed
error.sso_bad_provider_setup: This SSO provider is not fully setup in your .env file
error.sso_email_already_used: A user account with the same email address already exists but it does not match your external account ID. Do not use SSO if you are already registered on 2FAuth with this email.
error.unsupported_with_reverseproxy: Not applicable when using an auth proxy or SSO
error.unsupported_with_sso_only: This authentication method is for administrators only. Users must log in with SSO.
error.user_id_not_between_1_64: User ID was not between 1 and 64 chars
error.wrong_current_password: Wrong current password, nothing has changed
field.allow_pat_in_sso_only.help: Let users create personal access tokens and use them to authenticate with third party application like the 2FAuth web extension
field.apiToken.help: The Personal Access Token (PAT) to authenticate the extension to the server. You can generate one from the Settings > OAuth page of your 2FAuth user account
field.auto_close_timeout.help: Automatically hide on-screen password after a timeout. This avoids unnecessary requests for fresh passwords if you forget to close the password view.
field.auto_lock_extension.help: Lock the extension automatically to prevent illegitimate access to its data
field.auto_save_qrcoded_account.help: New accounts are automatically registered after scanning or uploading a QR code, no need to click a Save button
field.cache_management.help: Sometimes cache needs to be cleared, for instance after a change to environment variables or an update. You can do it from here.
field.clear_search_on_copy.help: Empty the Search box right after a code has been copied to the clipboard
field.close_otp_on_copy.help: Click on a generated password to copy it automatically hides it from the screen
field.disable_registration.help: Prevent new user registration. Unless overridden (see below), this affects SSO as well, so new users won't be able to sign in via SSO
field.enable_sso.help: Allow visitors to authenticate using an external ID via the Single Sign-On scheme
field.extCurrentPassword.help: The password currently used to unlock the extension
field.extNewPassword.help: The new password that will be used to lock this extension and encrypt sensitive data when needed
field.extPassword.help: The password that will be used to lock this extension and encrypt sensitive data when needed
field.group.help: The group to which the account is to be assigned
field.health_endpoint.help: URL you can visit to check the health of this 2FAuth instance. This URL can be used to set up a Docker HEALTHCHECK or a Kubernetes HTTPS Liveness probe.
field.hostUrl.help: The web address of the 2FAuth instance where you signed up. For example: https://2fauth.mysite.me
field.icon_collection.help: The icons collection to be queried at first when an official icon is required. Changing this setting does not refresh icons that have already been fetched.
field.icon_variant_strict_fetch.help: Narrow the fetch to the specified variant. If the variant is missing, 2FAuth will not try to fallback to the regular variant.
field.icon_variant.help: Some icons are available in different flavors to best suit dark or light user interfaces. Set the one you want to look for first. The regular variant will automatically be fetched as a fallback.
field.is_admin.help: Give administrator rights to the user. Administrators have permissions to manage the whole app, i.e. settings and other users, but cannot generate password for a 2FA they don't own.
field.keep_sso_registration_enabled.help: Allow new users to sign in for the first time via SSO whereas registration is disabled
field.name: –ò–º–µ
field.notify_on_failed_login.help: Get an email each time an attempt to connect to your 2FAuth account fails
field.notify_on_new_auth_device.help: Get an email when a new device connects to your 2FAuth account for the first time
field.otp_type: Choose the type of OTP to create
field.restrict_list.help: Emails in this list will be allowed to register. Separate addresses with a pipe ('|')
field.restrict_registration.help: Make registration only available to a limited range of email addresses. Both rules can be used simultaneously. This has no effect on registration via SSO.
field.restrict_rule.help: Emails matching this regular expression will be allowed to register
field.reveal_dotted_otp.help: Let the ability to temporarily reveal Dot-Obscured passwords
field.show_accounts_icons.help: Show account icons in the main view
field.show_email_in_footer.help: Display the logged-in user's email in the footer instead of direct navigation links. The links are then available in a menu behind a click/tap on the email address.
field.show_next_otp.help: Preview the next password, i.e. the password that will replace the current password when it expires. Preferences set for the current OTP also apply to the next one (formatting, show as dot)
field.show_otp_as_dot.help: Replace generated password characters with *** to ensure confidentiality. Does not affect the copy/paste feature
field.sort_case_sensitive.help: When invoked, force the Sort function to sort accounts on a case-sensitive basis
field.store_icon_to_database.help: Uploaded icons are registered in the database in addition to the file system storage, which is then used only as a cache. This makes creating a 2FAuth backup much easier, as only the database has to be backed up.
field.store_icon_to_database.help_bis: But beware, this may has some drawbacks: The database size may increase significantly if the instance hosts many large icons. It may also affect the application performance because the file system is hit more often to ensure it is synchronised with the database.
field.test_email.help: Send a test email to control your instance's email configuration. It is important to have a working configuration, otherwise users will not be able to request a reset password.
field.timezone.help: The time zone applied to all dates and times displayed in the application
field.use_encryption.help: Sensitive data, the 2FA secrets and emails, are stored encrypted in database. Be sure to backup the APP_KEY value of your .env file (or the whole file) as it serves as key encryption. There is no way to decypher encrypted data without this key.
field.use_sso_only.help: Make SSO the only available method to log in to 2FAuth. Password login and Webauthn are then disabled for regular users. Administrators are not affected by this restriction.
field.use_webauthn_only.help: Make WebAuthn the only authorized method to log into your 2FAuth account. This is the recommended setup to take advantage of the WebAuthn enhanced security.
field.use_webauthn_only.help_bis: In case of device lost, you will be able to recover your account by resetting this option and signing in using your email and password.
field.use_webauthn_only.help_ter: Attention! The Email & Password form remains available despite this option being enabled, but it will always return an 'Authentication failed' response.
field.view_default_group_on_copy.help: Always return to the default group when an OTP is copied
label.all_of_them_on_home.title: –ü–æ–∫–∞–∑–≤–∞–Ω–µ –Ω–∞ –≤—Å–∏—á–∫–∏ –ø–∞—Ä–æ–ª–∏ –≤ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–∏—è –∏–∑–≥–ª–µ–¥, –±–µ–∑ –¥–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∏—â–æ
label.alone_in_its_own_view.title: –©—Ä–∞–∫–Ω–µ—Ç–µ –≤—ä—Ä—Ö—É –∞–∫–∞—É–Ω—Ç, –∑–∞ –¥–∞ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏—Ç–µ –ø–∞—Ä–æ–ª–∞ –≤ –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω –∏–∑–≥–ª–µ–¥
link.see_how_to_enable_sso: See how to enable a provider
message.access_log_has_more_entries: The access log contains more entries.
message.account_bound_to_x_via_oauth: This account is bound to a {provider} account via OAuth
message.account_linked_to_sso_x_provider: You signed-in via SSO using your {provider} account. Your information cannot be changed here but on {provider}.
message.admin_users_legend: Manage users registered on your instance or create new ones.
message.auth_handled_by_proxy: Authentication handled by a reverse proxy, below settings are disabled.
message.bind_2fauth_to_use_extension: The perfect companion to your 2FAuth web application
message.delete_this_user_legend: The user account will be deleted as well as all its 2FA data.
message.deleting_2fauth_account_does_not: Deleting your 2FAuth account has no impact on your external SSO account.
message.email_will_be_send_to_x: The email will be send to {email}
message.enhance_security_using_webauthn: You can enhance the security of your 2FAuth account by enabling WebAuthn authentication.
message.ensure_you_open_mail_in_trusted_: Ensure you open the email on a device you fully own.
message.expected_format_for_direct_input: Expected: A list of otpauth URI, one by line
message.i_m_lucky_legend: The 'Try my luck' button tries to get a standard icon from the selected icon collection. The simpler the Service field value, the more likely you are to get the expected icon: Do not append any extension (like '.com'), use the exact name of the service, avoid special chars.
message.import_legend_afterpart: Use the Export feature of these apps to get a migration resource like a QR code or a JSON file then load it here.
message.import_legend: 2FAuth can import data from various 2FA apps.
message.is_pat_still_valid: Is your personal access token still valid?
message.manage_account_at_proxy_level: Manage the account at proxy level.
message.notifications.failed_login.conne: Here are the details of this connection attempt
message.notifications.failed_login.recom: If this was you, you can ignore this alert. If further attempts fail, you should contact the 2FAuth administrator to review security settings and take action against this attacker.
message.notifications.failed_login.resum: There has been a failed login attempt to your 2FAuth account.
message.notifications.new_device.connect: Here are the details of this connection
message.notifications.new_device.recomma: If this was you, you can ignore this alert. If you suspect any suspicious activity on your account, please change your password.
message.notifications.new_device.resume: A new device has just connected to your 2FAuth account.
message.notifications.new_device.subject: Connection to 2FAuth from a new device
message.notifications.test_email_setting: You are receiving this email because you requested a test email to validate the email settings of your 2FAuth instance.
message.otpauth_export_format_desc: otpauth URI is the most common format used to exchange 2FA data, for example in the form of a QR code when you enable 2FA on a web site. Select this if you want to switch from 2FAuth.
message.otpauth_export_format_sub: Export data as a list of otpauth URIs
message.password_login_and_webauthn_are_: Password login and WebAuthn are disabled.
message.password_request_expired: A password reset request exists for this user but has expired, meaning that the user has not changed their password in time. This may be a request from the user themselves or from an administrator.
message.password_requested_on_t: A password reset request exists for this user (request sent at {datetime}), which means that the user has not yet changed their password but the link they received is still valid. This may be a request from the user themselves or from an administrator.
message.purpose_description: This web extension is an add-on to the 2FAuth web application. It lets you access the 2FA data of your 2FAuth user account and generate OTPs directly from your browser bar.
message.purpose_requirements: You must have a 2FAuth user account and bind it to the extension in order to use it. This is done by providing the 2FAuth server address and a Personal Access Token (PAT).
message.recovery_punchline: 2FAuth will send you a recovery link to this email address. Click the link in the received email and follow the instructions.
message.registration_not_supported_visit: 2FA registraton from the extension is not supported yet. Visit your 2FAuth app to add your first 2FA.
message.resend_email_help: Use 'Resend email' to send a new password reset email to the user so he can set a new password. This will leave its current password as is and any previous request will be revoked.
message.reset_extension_description_bis: Use this option if you forgot the extension password.
message.reset_extension_description: The extension will be stripped of its current configuration and 2FAuth data. It will be available again for rebinding to a 2FAuth user account.
message.reset_password_help: Use 'Reset password' to force a password reset (this will set a temporary password) before sending a password reset email to the user so they can set a new password. Any previous request will be revoked.
message.reset_your_password_to_delete_yo: If you always used SSO to sign in, sign out then use the reset password feature to get a password so you can fill this form.
message.retry_or_reset_extension: You can try to refresh (maybe it was a temporary problem) or you can reset the extension and provide a new token.
message.settings_managed_by_administrato: Some settings are being managed by your administrator
message.sign_in_using_email_password: You can connect using the email address {email} and the password {password}
message.sign_in_using_sso: Pick an SSO provider to sign in with:
message.sso_only_form_restricted_to_admi: Regular users must sign in with SSO. Other methods are for administrators only.
message.sso_only_x_settings_are_disabled: Authentication is restricted to SSO only, {auth_method} is disabled
message.stream.need_grant_permission.cli: It is usually done by clicking on a slashed camera icon in or next to the browser's address bar
message.submitted_data_parsed_now_accoun: The following 2FA accounts were found in the migration resource. So far none of them have been added to 2FAuth.
message.supported_formats_for_qrcode_upl: –ü—Ä–∏–µ–º–∞—Ç —Å–µ: jpg, jpeg, png, bmp, gif, svg –∏–ª–∏ webp
message.this_is_not_soft_delete: This is not a soft delete, there is no going back.
message.token_remains_valid: This action does not revoke the personal access token in use.
message.twofauth_export_format_desc: You should prefer this option if you need to create a backup that can be restored. This format takes care of the icons.
message.twofauth_export_format_sub: Export data using the 2FAuth json schema
message.twofauth_export_format_url: The schema definition is described here:
message.twofauth_webext_teaser: A browser extension to retrieve 2FA security codes generated from your 2FAuth server.
message.unlock_description: The extension is locked to protect its data. Enter the extension password to access your 2FAs.
message.use_buttons_to_save_or_discard: Use the available buttons to permanently save them to your 2FA collection or discard them.
message.user_account_controlled_by_proxy: User account made available by an authentication proxy.
message.webauthn_uses_trusted_devices: WebAuthn allows you to use trusted devices (like Yubikeys or smartphones with biometric capabilities) to sign in quickly and more securely.
message.you_need_an_account_to_go_furthe: You need an account to go further, please register yourself.
notification.data_refreshed_to_reflect_s: Data has been refresh to reflect server-side changes
tooltip.otpauth_export_format_sub: Export data as a list of otpauth URIs
tooltip.resend_email_title: Resend a password reset email to the user
tooltip.show_last_month_log: Show entries from the last month
tooltip.show_one_year_log: Show entries from the last year
tooltip.show_six_months_log: Show entries from the last 6 months
tooltip.show_three_months_log: Show entries from the last 3 months
tooltip.twofauth_export_format_sub: Export data using the 2FAuth json schema
validation.ascii: The :attribute field must only contain single-byte alphanumeric characters and symbols.
validation.can: The :attribute field contains an unauthorized value.
validation.contains: The :attribute field is missing a required value.
validation.custom.email.ComplyWithEmailR: This email address does not comply with the registration policy
validation.custom.email.IsValidEmailList: All emails must be valid and separated with a pipe
validation.custom.icon.image: Supported format are jpeg, png, bmp, gif, svg, or webp.
validation.custom.qrcode.image: Supported format are jpeg, png, bmp, gif, svg, or webp.
validation.custom.secret.isBase32Encoded: The :attribute must be a base32 encoded string.
validation.custom.uri.regex: The :attribute is not a valid otpauth uri.
validation.decimal: The :attribute field must have :decimal decimal places.
validation.extensions: The :attribute field must have one of the following extensions: :values.
validation.hex_color: The :attribute field must be a valid hexadecimal color.
validation.IsValidRegex: The :attribute must be a valid regex pattern.
validation.list: The :attribute field must be a list.
validation.missing_if: The :attribute field must be missing when :other is :value.
validation.missing_unless: The :attribute field must be missing unless :other is :value.
validation.missing_with_all: The :attribute field must be missing when :values are present.
validation.missing_with: The :attribute field must be missing when :values is present.
validation.onlyCustomOtpWithUri: The uri parameter must be provided alone or only in combination with the 'custom_otp' parameter
validation.present_if: The :attribute field must be present when :other is :value.
validation.present_unless: The :attribute field must be present unless :other is :value.
validation.present_with_all: The :attribute field must be present when :values are present.
validation.present_with: The :attribute field must be present when :values is present.
validation.prohibited_if: The :attribute field is prohibited when :other is :value.
validation.prohibited_unless: The :attribute field is prohibited unless :other is in :values.
validation.prohibits: The :attribute field prohibits :other from being present.
validation.required_array_keys: The :attribute field must contain entries for: :values.
validation.required_if_accepted: The :attribute field is required when :other is accepted.
validation.required_if_declined: The :attribute field is required when :other is declined.
validation.required_if: The :attribute field is required when :other is :value.
validation.required_unless: The :attribute field is required unless :other is in :values.
validation.required_with_all: The :attribute field is required when :values are present.
validation.required_with: The :attribute field is required when :values is present.
validation.required_without_all: The :attribute field is required when none of :values are present.
validation.required_without: The :attribute field is required when :values is not present.
validation.single: When using :attribute it must be the only parameter in this request body
validation.starts_with: The :attribute must start with one of the following: :values.
validation.timezone: The :attribute must be a valid timezone.
validation.ulid: The :attribute field must be a valid ULID.
validation.url: The :attribute must be a valid URL.
validation.uuid: The :attribute must be a valid UUID.
